showerReviews.reviewText: Wonderful! We reserved a shelter for a small get together baby shower to be COVID compliant. A ranger stopped by to make sure everything was alright during our event. Our dog even attended!!! üòäHe was gracious and minimized his impact on our ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ , with only catfish biting (worms) near shore.  There's a small playground, and the bath house was well kept, though the shower plumbing was inconsistent between hot and cold directions!  (Test the shower water temp first for younger folk! ‚Ä¶
We had a nice campsite in first loop. Shower house old but functional. Very few trails, mainly just Mountain to Sea and short ones in camping area. Dog friendly. Nice staff at check-in.

‚Ä¶ Only downside was mowing on Wednesday while I was in the shower.... dust filled the restroom and a second shower was required to wash off the red rivulets from the dust, and I had to switch clothes. ‚Ä¶
Ample picnic tables and grills. There is a spot for everyone. Get the ones close to the beach and kids play area. There is a shower near kids play area.
Easy to check in and campsite was fine, but the water coming from our spout was yellow. It was also yellow in the toilets and shower. The video was after trying to let it run for a while.

Group camp sites are large enough to spread out, close to water and far enough away from other sites. Shower house is super clean. However, if you are looking to unplug and immerse yourself in nature this is not it. The Planes constantly ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ table. The dump station was in good condition.  Trash  dumpsters and trash cans are available. The bathrooms and shower facilities were clean and in good repair. We weren't there to boat, but noticed there is a Marina with gas available.
We camped here and it was beautiful, had good showers and a great lake area. Beware of swimmers itch though (shower with ample soap  immediately after enjoying the lake to avoid it).

‚Ä¶ this issue. There is another beach, however it's got a problem with fowl droppings. The second issue is that the shower water was a fixed temperature. Since we were there during the hottest day of the year to date, I REALLY wanted ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: Clean beach, multiple bathrooms, multiple shower areas, playground, lots of shaded picnic areas. $10 per car.

Beautiful beach, it's nice and long. This beach has two change houses/ restroom as well as an outdoor shower. There is a playground, though it is made of metal so when it is hot the play time is limited on it. Plenty of picnic tables and ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ was our first time there as a family and we really enjoyed it. The bathrooms are what you would expect at a public beach, but it also has a shower to get the sand off your feet before putting on your sandals etc. Nice vibe...we'll be back!
Great place to go and relax as if you were On the beaches themselves! Also has bathrooms and shower
